ru.myx.ae3.binary

Interface TransferCollector

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable, TransferSource

    public interface TransferCollector
extends java.io.Closeable, TransferSource
    A special type of object allowing non-blocking bufferisation between absorption made using Target or OutputStream and retrieval via Source methods. Any collector implementation have to be safe for at least 2-Thread multithreading when one thread writes to a collector and another thread is reading. Idea is to collect in memory or disk dynamically generated data and to collect references on statically available data.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static TransferCollector NUL_COLLECTOR
      NUL COLLECTOR instance - dummy collector.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      No writes are allowed to a collector after calling this method.
      java.io.OutputStream getOutputStream()
      Returns an output stream object to fill collector.
      TransferTarget getTarget()
      Returns a transfer target object to fill collector.
      void printBytes(byte[] bytes) 
      void printUtf8(String string)
      void printString(String string, Charset charset); void printString(String string, String encoding) throws UnsupportedEncodingException;
      void reset()
      This method should reset any collector in any state to an clean, empty, opened and ready to absorb condition.
      void startChunking(int minChunk, int maxChunk)
      Activates the 'chunking' state on this collector, any data written to a collector will be divided into chunks whose maximal size is specified as maxChunk argument.
      void stopChunking()
      Forces collector to exit it's 'chunking' state and write an exit sequence for a chunked-encoded data.
      TransferCopier toBinary()
      If collector is not closed yet close() method will be called automatically.
      TransferBuffer toBuffer()
      Returns whole contents of closed collector as a buffer, collector is reset and ready to absorb new data after this method is returned.
      TransferCopier toCloneFactory()
      Returns a factory whose nextSource() method always returns a Buffer object with the same contents as in this whole Source.

        connectTarget

    • Field Detail

      • NUL_COLLECTOR

        static final TransferCollector NUL_COLLECTOR
        NUL COLLECTOR instance - dummy collector. It is important to use this one - since implementations can easily check for equality and perform some shortcuts while rendering something.

      • reset

        void reset()

      • startChunking

        void startChunking(int minChunk,
                   int maxChunk)
            throws IllegalStateException,
                   IllegalArgumentException
        Activates the 'chunking' state on this collector, any data written to a collector will be divided into chunks whose maximal size is specified as maxChunk argument. minChank argument should be used as a hint to create some buffers while collecting. Collected data can be read in form of chunked-encoding (as specified in MIME protocol).
        Parameters:
        minChunk -
        maxChunk -
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException
        IllegalArgumentException

      • stopChunking

        void stopChunking()
           throws IllegalStateException
        Forces collector to exit it's 'chunking' state and write an exit sequence for a chunked-encoded data. This method should be called automatically when invoking collector's close() method while in 'chunking' state.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException

      • toBinary

        TransferCopier toBinary()
        If collector is not closed yet close() method will be called automatically. Returns a factory whose nextSource() method always returns a Buffer object with the same contents as in this whole Source. After execution of this method source should be in exhausted state, collector is reset and ready to absorb new data after this method is returned
        Returns:
        copier

      • toBuffer

        TransferBuffer toBuffer()
        Returns whole contents of closed collector as a buffer, collector is reset and ready to absorb new data after this method is returned.
        Returns:
        buffer

      • toCloneFactory

        TransferCopier toCloneFactory()
        Returns a factory whose nextSource() method always returns a Buffer object with the same contents as in this whole Source. After execution of this method source should be in exhausted state, collector is reset and ready to absorb new data after this method is returned
        Returns:
        copier
